block.p: The Bush administration, eager to build ties with India and pressed by companies seeking to limit actions curtailing global warming, found a way to please both in one stroke. The State Department endorsed an Indian engineer to replace Dr. Robert T. Watson as the unpaid chairman of an international scientific panel studying climate. Dr. Watson has been criticized by industry as overstating the risks of warming. But the endorsement comes with its own risks. The engineer, Dr. Rajendra K. Pachauri -- who is also an economist -- last year repeatedly criticized President Bush for not taking the issue seriously.
